lessons.Subject: English
lessons.Learning Objective: Use known spelling patterns to correctly spell most commonly used words.

lessons.Learning Objective: Show understanding of word families; roots; derivations and morphology in spelling.

lessons.Learning Objective: Use relevant strategies for spelling correctly.

lessons.Subject: English
lessons.Learning Objective: Deduce the meanings of unfamiliar words in context using a range of strategies; including knowledge of word families; etymology and morphology.

lessons.Learning Objective: Comment on a writerâ€™s choice of language; demonstrating an understanding of the impact on the reader.

lessons.Subject: English
lessons.Learning Objective: Describe how linguistic and literary techniques are used to create effects in a specific context; and use accurate terminology; e.g. using terms such as assonance or sibilance to differentiate between types of phonetic repetition.

lessons.Learning Objective: Comment on the use of punctuation to create effects; e.g. using an ellipsis to show a cliffhanger.

lessons.Learning Objective: Identify differences between formal and informal language.

lessons.Learning Objective: Use ellipses; colons; semi-colons; dashes and hyphens; including hyphens for compound adjectives.

lessons.Learning Objective: Use a range of punctuation accurately to clarify meaning in sentences and dialogue.

lessons.Learning Objective: Build up detail through the grammatical structure of sentences; e.g. expanding verb phrases.

lessons.Learning Objective: Use the conventions of standard English consistently in writing.

lessons.Learning Objective: Use formal and informal registers appropriately according to context; purpose and audience.

lessons.Learning Objective: Comment on the impact of a writer's choice of connectives and sentence openings on the intended purpose and audience.

lessons.Subject: English
lessons.Learning Objective: Express personal responses to texts; including preferences and opinions; referring back to specific content.

lessons.Learning Objective: Discuss how readers make choices about which texts to read.

lessons.Learning Objective: Use language precisely to clarify and extend intended meaning.

lessons.Learning Objective: Use a range of sources to develop and extend the range of language used in written work.

lessons.Subject: English
lessons.Learning Objective: Shape the overall structure and sequence of a chosen text to convey the intended purpose accurately.

lessons.Subject: English
lessons.Learning Objective: Use a range of organisational features accurately to link ideas; and clarify and extend meaning.

lessons.Learning Objective: Create content to suit a specified audience.

lessons.Learning Objective: Sustain a fast; fluent and legible handwriting style.

lessons.Learning Objective: Use different ways of note-taking when writing for different purposes and use notes to inform writing.

lessons.Learning Objective: Use different layouts and presentation in a variety of texts (handwritten; printed and onscreen).

lessons.Learning Objective: Adapt speech; including length; pace and tone; in a range of contexts; showing some awareness of its impact.

lessons.Learning Objective: Identify points of agreement and disagreement in opposing points of view.
